results.title: Risk of acute atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease in patients with acute and chronic pancreatitis
results.text_hl: In conclusion, we reported that @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with acute @<m>DISEASE_Pancreatitis_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050500 @@@or chronic pancreatitis@@@ were more likely to have acute @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@ASCVD@@@, particularly those with pancreas-related comorbidities, while the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is associated with a reduced risk of acute @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@ASCVD@@@.

citations.NLM: Sung LC, Chang CC, Lin CS, Yeh CC, Cherng YG, Chen TL, Liao CC. Risk of acute atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease in patients with acute and chronic pancreatitis Sci Rep. 2021 Oct 22;11(1):20907. PMID: 34686769

results.title: Pancreatogenic diabetes: special considerations for management.
results.text_hl: @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@Insulin@@@ and insulin secretagogue treatment increases the risk of @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@malignancy@@@, whereas @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy reduces it.
